{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3311394,"name":"Alex","username":"legoguy1000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-17T00:03:24.385Z","cooked":"

We are running a command based Java robot using Advantage kit to log. We are running into a weird issue where our network tables server repeatedly restarts and disconnects all the clients multiple times. It tends to repeat several times after deploying code and then the Roborio 1 runs out of memory and clears up after about 30 seconds. I know theres a bunch of loop overruns and we’re looking into that as well but we’ve never seen this issue with network tables before. For context, we have 4 Orange Pis running photon vision that connect to NT in addition to Advantage Scope and Driver station when this is happening.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-17T00:03:24.385Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":543,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":2755.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":455062,"topic_slug":"network-tables-disconnect","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/network-tables-disconnect/455062/1","custom_user_title":"Mentor & Alumnus","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3311408,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-17T00:26:45.461Z","cooked":"

First, are you running 2024.2.1 (check build.gradle)? If not, upgrade first.

If you are, it’s possible to still starve the NT processing loop by using too much CPU. In helping another team this week using AKit, it’s possible to get in a runaway condition with some of the odometry processing as AKit doesn’t limit the size of the queues in e.g. PhoenixOdometryThread.

I also just found and fixed an issue which made NT processing of local updates take longer than it should, which tends to impact AKit users more. It will be in the next WPILib release (expected in the next few days).

Yes we’re on 2024.2.1.

Were you able to fix this issue? My team is encountering the exact same thing and is on 2024.3.1

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-02-22T06:55:21.001Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":122.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":455062,"topic_slug":"network-tables-disconnect","display_username":"Akshay Anand","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":28614,"username":"legoguy1000","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64451,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/network-tables-disconnect/455062/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3314936,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-22T07:15:38.097Z","cooked":"

Are you also using AdvantageKit? Make sure you’re limiting the size of queues in the odometry thread (see Odometry queues are unlimited in size · Issue #73 · Mechanical-Advantage/AdvantageKit · GitHub), and otherwise optimize CPU and NT usage. There’s only so much I can do in NT if it’s not getting enough CPU time to actually process data.

This issue happens when I use shuffleboard. I’m also using a raspberry pi coprocessor, so when this is connected to my radio via ethernet, I get the errors above. However, when I disconnect my raspberry pi from my robot’s wifi, the errors go away. The RPI is using networktables to send values to the roborio.

Did you also upgrade shuffleboard to 2024.3.1 (check in Help | About there, and in build.gradle for your robot code)?

Can you add the following to your code, reproduce the problem, and post the .wpilog file somewhere I can download it?

StringLogEntry entry = new StringLogEntry(DataLogManager.getLog(), "/ntlog");
NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().addLogger(0, 100,
    event -> entry.append(event.logMessage.filename + ":" + event.logMessage.line + ":" + event.logMessage.message));

This will give me a lot more debug information to go from. Thanks!
